db:abstract.db:para: The QPrinterInfo class gives access to information about existing printers.
This class was introduced in Qt 4.4.

db:listitem.db:para: QPrinterInfo is part of Printer and Printing APIs

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Use the static functions to generate a list of QPrinterInfo objects. Each QPrinterInfo object in the list represents a single printer and can be queried for name, supported paper sizes, and whether or not it is the default printer.

db:section.db:title: QPrinterInfo::QPrinterInfo()
db:section.db:para: Constructs an empty QPrinterInfo object.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QPrinterInfo::QPrinterInfo(const QPrinter &printer)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QPrinterInfo object from printer.

db:section.db:title: QPrinterInfo::QPrinterInfo(const QPrinterInfo &other)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a copy of other.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QPrinterInfo::~QPrinterInfo()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the QPrinterInfo object. References to the values in the object become invalid.

db:section.db:title: [static] QList<QPrinterInfo> QPrinterInfo::availablePrinters()
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of available printers on the system.

db:section.db:title: [static] QPrinterInfo QPrinterInfo::defaultPrinter()
db:section.db:para: Returns the default printer on the system.
The return value should be checked using isNull() before being used, in case there is no default printer.
On some systems it is possible for there to be available printers but none of them set to be the default printer.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.0] QString QPrinterInfo::description() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the human-readable description of the printer.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: bool QPrinterInfo::isDefault() const
db:section.db:para: Returns whether this printer is the default printer.

db:section.db:title: bool QPrinterInfo::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns whether this QPrinterInfo object holds a printer definition.
An empty QPrinterInfo object could result for example from calling defaultPrinter() when there are no printers on the system.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.0] QString QPrinterInfo::location() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the human-readable location of the printer.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.0] QString QPrinterInfo::makeAndModel() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the human-readable make and model of the printer.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: [static, since 5.0] QPrinterInfo QPrinterInfo::printerInfo(const QString &printerName)
db:section.db:para: Returns the printer printerName.
The return value should be checked using isNull() before being used, in case the named printer does not exist.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: QString QPrinterInfo::printerName() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the name of the printer.
This is a unique id to identify the printer and may not be human-readable.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.4] QList<QPrinter::PaperSize> QPrinterInfo::supportedPaperSizes() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of supported paper sizes by the printer.
Not all printer drivers support this query, so the list may be empty. On Mac OS X 10.3, this function always returns an empty list.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.4.

db:section.db:title: QPrinterInfo &QPrinterInfo::operator=(const QPrinterInfo &other)
db:section.db:para: Sets the QPrinterInfo object to be equal to other.
